attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Service charges & tips should be given to staff automatically by law
attributes.background:
The TV chef Michel Roux Jr has admitted his Michelin-starred Le Gavroche restaurant keeps 100% of the service charge added to bills instead of distributing the cash to staff in addition to their pay.

The government ran a consultation this summer but no law has been passed so far.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of honey in order to fight the decline in bee populations
attributes.background: The impact that the honey industry has on bee populations is detrimental - by taking away their honey, we are depriving them of their ability to feed their young and to insulate their hives. We demand a total ban on the sale of honey in the UK to help protect our bees from extinction.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, there has been lots of media coverage surrounding the decline in bee populations. It is no secret that if bees go extinct, we are only a couple of years behind.
Bees produce honey for two reasons – to feed their young, and to insulate their hives, therefore by taking their honey from them we are depriving them of their ability to carry out these essential survival functions. It is vital that we stop this practice for the bees' sake, for our sake and for the sake of our planet.

attributes.action: Review above inflation interest rates applied to Plan2 Student Loans in England
attributes.background:
The Plan2 annual rate of interest while students are studying is RPI plus 3% and continues to be above RPI unless earnings stay below £21,000.
Previous Plan2 %rates (Plan1 pre-2012) are:
2012/13	 6.6% (1.5%)
2013/14	 6.3% (1.5%)
2014/15    5.5% (1.5%)
2015/16	 3.9% (0.9%)
2016/17	 4.6% (1.25%)
attributes.additional_details:
The uncertain economic future after the EU Referendum leaves Plan2 borrowers vulnerable. In addition, there is the looming threat of the Plan2 student loan book being sold to a private sector financial institution. 
This petition asks the government to review Plan2 student loans to remove above inflation interest rates and introduce a cap; thus protecting English students from becoming “an indentured class of graduates from whom higher repayments can be extracted.” (McGettigan, A)  @plan2fight

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Candidates must have lived in the seat for 2 years before standing
attributes.background: I find it undemocratic that Parliamentary Candidates can stand with no history or knowledge whatsoever of the seat, whereas you must be on the Electoral roll or live in the ward for local elections.
attributes.additional_details:
Here in North Dorset we had a very able local hopeful for the Tories, however the candidate selected was from the PM;s home town of Witney, having stood in the previous election in Cardiff.
This is the Westminster bubble in action.

attributes.action: Make learning and understanding about disabilities part of the curriculum.
attributes.background: As a mother of a young child who has Autism it's a topic close to my heart. We will encounter people from all backgrounds around the world in life that will have a disability. Teaching our youth of today about disabilities and how we are all equal instead of growing up with no knowledge/awareness.
attributes.additional_details: In current curriculum there's areas that need a helping hand. I'm sure that many will agree that there's alot of unhelpful information you received that didn't really help you in 'real' life. By signing this petition your giving people who haven't got a voice a chance to push for a cause that I feel should have always been in place. Why aren't we made aware of disabilities and how we can help others. "Bless those that see the world through a different window and those who understand their view"

attributes.action: Mandatory dog bite prevention in the school and preschool curriculum
attributes.background: It has become apparent with recent tragic events the current system does not stop or decrease dog bites and hospitalisation . I feel education in dog handling and bite prevention is a key area in tackling dog bites as the largest demographic is young children , many bites can be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
Bite statistics rise every year . Far too much blame is put on the breed of dog luring many owners of other breeds into a false sense of security . Many of the worlds top trainers and behaviourists such as victoria stillwell , jo rosie , nando brown , cesar millan all disagree with breed specific legislation and promote bite prevention , education and responsible dog ownership. Nearly all dog bites are preventable . 
Lets teach our children how to be safe around dogs!

attributes.action: Keep the ban on building new Grammars and keep the Comprehensive school system.
attributes.background: Theresa May has said she wants to bring back grammars this could take away opportunities for people like me who have learning difficulties as well as bring in a class divide because of tutors to help kids pass the test pricing others out.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: Make Health Tourists pay for their treatment
attributes.background: We believe that people who are not from the UK and use the NHS for treatment should be made to pay. Health Tourism costs the NHS between £200m and £2bn. It is time the Government acted and stopped the chronic abuse of health tourists using the NHS for free and made them pay their way.

attributes.action: Devolve immigration and trade powers to devolved assemblies and Gibraltar
attributes.background:
Each devolved legislature (Scottish Parliament, National Assembly for Wales, Northern Ireland Assembly, London Assembly) and the Gibraltar Parliament shall be granted the power to:

- ratify and make trade treaties (including EU/EEA membership)
- control and decide their own immigration policies
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland’s Place in Europe: http://www.gov.scot/Resource/0051/00512073.pdf

Securing Wales’ Future: https://beta.gov.wales/sites/default/files/2017-01/30683%20Securing%20Wales%C2%B9%20Future_ENGLISH_WEB.pdf

Devolved Parliaments and Assemblies: http://www.parliament.uk/about/how/role/devolved/

Devolution in the United Kingdom: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devolution_in_the_United_Kingdom

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: Ensure Gender Inequality is taught as part of secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: Our aim is to spread awareness of the impact in which these subtle but meaningful gender stereotypes impact on women, men and children in society unwittingly. Promote high self esteem as well as to recognize the impact these portrayals have on different people.

attributes.action: Reduction of tuition fees to £6,000 per annum
attributes.background: We spend most of our youth in school, to then spend the rest of our lives paying it off. Lowering the fees provides greater opportunities to educate more of our society and potentially help the disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Ban pictures of children from online dating/sexual encounter profiles
attributes.background: At present it isn't illegal to put pictures of your children on dating websites/apps intended to facilitate sexual meets. There is nothing the police or social services can do if this occurs and persons use pictures of their children to aid their dating breaching the child's rights/privacy+safety.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother who has recently had her children recognised in the street due to the father using pics of the children on online sex apps I want change.

I have spoken to the police and social services and it isn't an offence to use pictures on these post 18 sites.

It is illegal for children to have social media yet parents can put them in the public domain to help obtain sexual partners.

Legally! Please can we act together to get this discussed in parliament - children's safety is critical!

attributes.action: Introduce tax on disposable coffee cups to reduce waste
attributes.background:
2,500,000,000 disposable coffee cups are thrown away in the UK each year. 

1 in 400 are recycled. The coffee industry and chains are NOT doing enough voluntarily to reduce waste. The tax for plastic bags worked-use fell massively. Let's consider the environment and do the same with coffee cups.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to start reducing our waste now before it is too late.

100,000 trees are used for the cups each year: 
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/oct/05/uks-billions-of-takeaway-cups-could-each-take-30-years-to-break-down

Ministers reject coffee cup tax despite massive wastage: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/oct/31/ministers-reject-calls-for-charge-on-disposable-coffee-cups

Plastic bag reductions: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36917174

attributes.action: Public Debate and Referendum on Fracking (Shale Gas) in the UK
attributes.background:
Fracking is a controversial process to extract natural gas by fracturing surrounding rock and directly a high pressure mix to release the gas.

I ask for a referendum on whether fracking should be allowed in the UK at all.  Public opinion seems strongly against yet applications are being approved.
attributes.additional_details:
Fracking is once again in the media with the Government ruling that horizontal fracking can go ahead in Lancashire. It follows the approval of fracking at Kirby Misperton in May (although this is delayed to to legal challenges).

There is little consensus on the long term impacts on the area and the surrounding areas after fracking. Examples in the US have resulted in water contamination and air pollution causing headaches and nausea not to mention confirmation of causing earthquakes.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions against the Philippine government for extra-judicial killings
attributes.background: The Philippine government is openly cleansing it's society of criminals by executing them. It is unacceptable for Britain to trade with a country that supports this policy. We demand that suspected criminals receive a fair trial as detailed in Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
attributes.additional_details:
Drug addiction is linked to poor life chances and trauma and many addicts require support and don't deserve to be killed. 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/related-topics/addiction-science

attributes.action: Improve patient choice for the use of CHC Funding
attributes.background: CCG's have cut the number of of care homes they will allow a patient to choose from to use their CHC Funding.  Patients cannot choose care settings not on these limited lists even if they are prepared to pay the top-up and they have a better CQC rating causing great upset to patients and families.
attributes.additional_details: Patients are being prevented from choosing their own care setting under CCG red tape that prevents them from choosing a home that isn't on a predetermined list.  This is the case even when a patient or their family agree to pay the top up so the cost of the home of choice is no more than any other on 'the list'.  This red tape is preventing patients from choosing homes that are close to relatives and that have a better CQC rating than ones approved by the CCG for their list.

attributes.action: Abolish Bedroom Tax on all Council Properties
attributes.background: This Bedroom Tax is affecting thousands of families all across the UK, when it was originally imposed there was a lot of debate to abolish it and yet this has not been done.
attributes.additional_details:
This affects everyone living in social housing; disabled, welfare recipients, and those who work. If you live in a council property and have any spare bedrooms, you will be forced to pay the tax whatever your personal situation may be; even if you have lived in that property for up to 22 years. 

The government has decided that:

* Any single person aged 16 or over needs their own bedroom.
* A couple need a bedroom.
* A child needs a bedroom BUT.....
* A boy and a girl are expected to share a bedroom if they are both under 10.
* 2 boys or 2 girls are expected to share if they are both under 16. See below for examples.
* Foster children are not taken into account 
* Children who stay with you part of the time aren’t taken into account.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate a motion of no confidence in the current British Government
attributes.background: The recent foreign policy moves to remove the UK from the EU regardless of the damage it will do and the invite of Donald Trump to come to the UK on a State Visit  indicates a government that acts without care or diligence and is losing the confidence of much of the electorate each passing day.
attributes.additional_details: Much of the decisions being made by the current government appear disjointed, taken purely for short term reasons and to please only a portion of the electorate rather than for the greater good of all of the citizens of the four nations of these islands. The hasty invite to Donald Trump to meet the Queen now points to a government with an overall agenda that is ill-conceived. As such they are not fit to govern and a general election should be called.

attributes.action: Appoint ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.background: There should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. It is my proposal that all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.
attributes.additional_details: In 1969, John Lennon sang “All we are saying is Give Peace a Chance”. In 2017, all I am saying is give peace a better chance. I believe there should be a mechanism that would make it easier to achieve peace than to achieve war, easier to facilitate peace in Northern Ireland than to start a war in Iraq. Following the appointment of Fabian Hamilton to the position of Shadow Minister for Peace and Disarmament – a post created in 2016 by Labour Leader Jeremy Corbyn – it is my proposal that from now on all UK governments must include the senior cabinet positions of Ministers for Peace and Disarmament.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for building companies to have indemnity insurance
attributes.background: This is to protect consumers against rogue traders, not finishing work, doing incorrect and unsafe work then closing that business down and the consumer unable to claim  any monies back from the builder. This way consumers could then claim against their insurance.

attributes.action: Amend prior approval for phone masts to include a minimum distance from houses
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum distance stipulated for masts. They are cautious not to site masts next to playgrounds and schools but are happy to site them next to residential gardens with established play areas. Neighbours should actually be consulted prior to the submission of an application.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples across the country of mobile phone companies exploiting the relaxed planning rules by trying to site masts within so called 'breaks in the residential nature of the search area'. If the LPA does not refuse or grant an application for prior approval within 56 days its prior approval is automatically deemed to have been given and the mast can be built even if it is within a few metres of a residential property. The process needs to be far more transparent.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares for anyone under 18
attributes.background: Change the law to require all transport operators to offer under 18's a child fair to help financially support 16!17 year olds of the UK. We are being classed as adults when it suits financially only.
attributes.additional_details: 16/17 year olds are paid a child wage so why should we pay an adult fare for a bus or a train? Until 18, we are not treated as an adult by the law. Until we are 18, parents and doctors can legally consent medical treatment which over rules our say. It seems to be all that is cared about is getting more money. As a 16 year old preparing for the cost of insuring a car and saving for university, it is essentially unaffordable, and this is the reality for most of us.

attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: Mandate ethnic diversity in jury selection where minorities are defendants.
attributes.background: The view that currently underpins jury policy in England & Wales is that a randomly selected jury is most likely to be representative and therefore most likely to be impartial. However several studies have shown that it is in the nature of random selection that some juries will be unrepresentative.
attributes.additional_details:
This particularly applies to cases involving defendants from ethnic minorities. Random selection from a populous where 87.2% of people are white, naturally results in a high likelihood of white-only juries. This raises conflicts in cultural norms and community values. Parliament needs to ensure that this imbalance is removed and one is judged by 'a jury of their peers' to preserve equality, fairness and overall confidence in our legal system.

https://goo.gl/vZxgqS
https://goo.gl/EbKEld

attributes.action: Make "critical thinking" a mandatory subject in secondary school.
attributes.background: Critical thinking skills will allow the UK populous to improve their decision making process. Making critical thinking mandatory in schools will lead to future generations being better equipped to question what they are told in terms of facts and feasibility.
attributes.additional_details: The National Council for Excellence in Critical Thinking defines critical thinking as the "intellectually disciplined process of actively and skillfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action."

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Enforce tougher penalties for mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.background: While driving around the country with work, I witness far too many drivers all over the road because they are using their mobile phones, mainly in their hands, while driving. This is mostly texting or typing. The current fine and penalty points are far too low and the penalty must be higher.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who text on the road are in far more danger than intoxicated drivers.

A Techtimes study results show those who occupied themselves with text messages, either by reading or writing them, had slower reactions times by 35%. By comparison, drunk drivers displayed a 12% decrease in reaction time, while drivers intoxicated with cannabis had slowed response times by 21%. http://www.techtimes.com/articles/8185/20140609/texting-is-more-dangerous-than-drugs-alcohol-while-driving-study.htm

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on the US as Trump threatens human rights, speech & environment
attributes.background: After a few days in office Trump has resurrected plans for oil pipelines opposed by the people, stripped funding from reproductive services, put gag orders on US government agencies and is planning to start building a border wall. Anywhere else these actions would be recognised as dictatorial.
attributes.additional_details:
Trump's actions will affect the environment to an irreversible degree, force women to fall back on dangerous abortion methods. Free speech and movement will be impeded. Please show him that the UK does not condone his dictatorial and divisive actions early on by imposing economic sanctions on the USA. If he does not get challenged things will get worse.

http://tinyurl.com/hzarqrq 
http://tinyurl.com/zsctvbm 
http://tinyurl.com/hyoe3fd 
http://tinyurl.com/h4pm5vf
http://tinyurl.com/hlsycfp

attributes.action: Ensure every school in the UK has Bullying awareness lessons for ages 5-16
attributes.background: Bullying effects many peoples lives, touches many family's & interrupts the personal and academic growth of every child. Personally as a child back in 1993 i was affected by bullying that still makes a impact on my adulthood today. I just don't see any improvement since then to protect our children
attributes.additional_details:
This petition suggests some of the following:

Every school is required by education policy through DfE to have group discussions setting out a plan on how to help pupils report bullying, its effects and challenges throughout academic growth.

Requests each school in UK to have Bullying awareness lessons ages 5-16 at least 3 times a year.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Change the way Statutory Redundancy Payments are calculated please
attributes.background:
The current SRP is calculated by using your present salary only and this needs to change.  Working people that previously held full time roles within their company cannot use these years at the higher salary rate to calculate their final payment.  
A fair adjustment mechanism needs to be created.
attributes.additional_details:
Mum works part time for the last five years after giving birth but, had previously worked full time in the same role for ten years.  
The company decides to restructure and her role is made redundant.
Mum can only claim 15 years service at the part time salary.  
Result, greatly reduced final payment.
The full time salary should be used to calculate the 10 years working full time hours and part time salary to calculate the remaining 5 years.
Result, fair SRP using company records.

attributes.action: Allow homosexual men to donate blood, if they have evidence of their HIV status.
attributes.background: Homosexual men are not allowed to donate blood due to the myth of HIV being active only in homosexual men. The law states that men who are homosexual and have had sex in the past year are not allowed to donate blood, whether or not they can prove they don't have HIV.

attributes.action: Elevate the Cotswolds area of outstanding natural beauty to national park status
attributes.background: The Cotswolds is already an area of outstanding natural beauty, but continues to be accosted by unsuitable development. By elevating it to become a national park, increased protections in planning law will defend its beauty for generations to come and provide a much needed Midlands national park.

attributes.action: Reduce the annual income for a spousal visa to be in line with living wage
attributes.background:
The spousal visa requirement means that I must be earning £18,600 a year (and increases with dependents) To even be consider for the visa means that most people cannot afford to be in love.
I myself work two well paid jobs and still don't meet the criteria. This means my husband cannot join me.
attributes.additional_details:
The visa requirement would be much fairer for all if it was in line with the living wage and would stop the separation of 43% of family's.

This requirement has been a problem for many families for a long time and something needs to change. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/feb/21/families-challenge-minimum-income-visa-rules-supreme-court-non-eu-partner 

There should not be a price to pay for being happy and in love.

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Close hospitality establishments over the Christmas period.
attributes.background: Christmas is a family time, hospitality workers work extremely hard during the Christmas run up and many don't get Christmas day off, nevermind boxing day. Some things are needed over the festive period; eating out isn't one of them.
attributes.additional_details: As a chef, it is expected that I will work over the festive period, including Christmas day, boxing day and all bank holidays, with no extra incentive.   I fully support retail workers having Christmas day AND Boxing day off, but this should be extended to those who work in hospitality too. This is especially important for those who work away from their hometowns, as one day off is not long enough to get home to see their family and means a Christmas day spent alone.

attributes.action: Scrap car tax and put 1p on a litre of fuel.
attributes.background: Scrapping car tax (ved) and putting 1p on fuel will ensure everyone who drives pays the same, regardless of engine size, and no one can evade paying excise duty on fuel.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: Scrap plans for HS2 and invest the money in our Armed Forces and NHS.
attributes.background: A country the size of Britain does not need this type of rail service. People on the average wage won't be able afford to use this just rich business people. This money spent on our NHS & Armed Forces would enable us to rebuild them to there former glorys!

attributes.action: Restart Flights to Sharm El Shiekh
attributes.background: Back in October 2015, a Russian flight crashed in Sinai with a suspicion of bombing.After that, many countries had suspended their flights to Sharm El Sheikh.This action has led to many consequences to Egypt's Tourism industry. The Egyptian government had already adopted new security measures.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cairoscene.com/BusinessAndPolitics/Egypt-to-Install-Biometric-Equipment-to-Bolster-Airport-Security

http://egyptianstreets.com/2017/01/12/egypt-introduces-new-security-measures-for-everyone-travelling-to-south-sinai/

http://egyptianstreets.com/2016/09/28/egypts-tourist-numbers-drop-51-2-in-first-half-of-2016-capmas/

attributes.action: Allow GP's to be able to refer patients to out of area mental health services
attributes.background: With physical health you can request to be referred to a different hospital not in your borough through your GP. With mental health your GP can only refer you to the mental health services in your area. Patients should be able to request to go to specialised services through their GP for all health.
attributes.additional_details:
More patients are being referred back to their GP's and they can be the person who knows the patient best and need to have the option of sending the patient else where.

It could in certain situations help people get the help they need quicker if a GP can refer patients even if their service did refer them after being assessed onto somewhere that has wasted so much time and money that could've been saved if the GP and patient already knew where they needed to be referred to have the assessment.
